website_summaries.verdict: The Surface Pro 4 is the best version of Microsoft's tablet yet, with a stellar display, snappy performance, and more than 10 hours of battery life. With Windows 10, the Surface Pen, and optional Type Cover, it can replace your laptop.
pros: Improved Surface Pen and Type Cover from the previous iteration

customer_reviews.title: For the money you would expect a bit more reliability ...
customer_reviews.text: For the money you would expect a bit more reliability!! This product gives me daily problems. Outlook freezing, Bluetooth connections with other MS devices dropping etc etc. I will definably not be buying anything from MS again. The docking station connection and disconnect is convenient but many programmes such as Quick Books and Adobe DC Reader don't resize from the monitor and requires a restart anyway, Then it takes ages for the BT mouse and Keyboard to re connect if it ever does. And I can go on but I have waited too much time on this machine this morning already. Rubbish for £1799.00 (I have had this product for 12 months)
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great design but poor quality - not worth the premium price tag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device almost three years ago and it’s been replaced twice (with refurb’d devices). First time: the battery started to bulge. Second time: the screen started to flicker (after a couple of months usage!). When I spend this amount of money on something, I expect it to last. This is just crazy. I have had laptops and desktops from other manufacturers and I’ve never experienced this level of defects. As you can probably guess, based on my experience I do not recommend the Surface Pro line.
customer_reviews.author: H. Bokhari

customer_reviews.title: I'd confidently recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Surface Pro 4 for a few months now and really like it. It's pretty much replaced any laptop or tablet usage in one neat device. The only issues I have come across are more down to the operating system than anything else, and can be worked around. It's not the cheapest device for the hardware but it is more than capable and you are paying for the design/features. I'd confidently recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B. P. Clarkson

customer_reviews.title: Why on earth didn't I get one of these before!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this! It's a tablet, and with the keyboard attached, it's also a laptop. I like the stand, which means I can work on this on the table, or on my lap. So far as functionality is concerned, there are plenty of reviews out there on the net, but I will say that I've found it does everything I need, and there are 50 million things it can do which I haven't even discovered before. The screen is absolutely crystal clear, the colours pop out, and I have no problem at all with the screen size. Totally portable, though it's fair to say I have a pretty big handbag!

Refund requested, wouldn’t gamble on another.

This could easily be resolved if access to Google Play is established. Other than that, I am very pleased with my purchase so....4 stars !

In the 4 days since it arrived, I have not yet tried Tablet mode (as my main machine has been a Win10 desktop with no touch-screen) nor yet graphics (which is a large part of the reason I bought it), but the service has been excellent and the machine seems very promising.

The volume buttons have been moved to the top of the device which can be quite disorienting for those upgrading. Lastly, it has a Windows Hello camera, which replaces you pin and password. These range from the CPU spiking and running too high, through to the back of it getting scratched (it lives on a perfectly flat, wooden table) and it not waking up from sleep mode (as everyone's experienced). It also runs hot, and is too small to be used for any seriously long work sessions. Very fiddly compared to a desk top. Oh, and the battery life is nowhere near 7 hours. 3 or 4 max...and that's on the lowest performance. And Microsoft have been a nightmare about solving any of the problems mentioned above (CPU, running hot). Their solution? Send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Faulty WiFi an unadvertised 'feature'
customer_reviews.text: Nearly 700 quid and the WiFi doesn't work properly. A longstanding known issue at Microsoft. Absolutely disgraceful.The battery life is terrible, around half of the claimed 9 hours when fully charged. Plus the touch screen keyboard con attenuates words that I haven't typed to words that I have typed. I'm losing the will to live.
customer_reviews.author: Mr P J Lythgoe

customer_reviews.title: 'Marvel Ous'!  Thor ally impressed
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply my best IT purchase in 10 years. Once I got my head around the fact that this wolf was wearing sheep's clothing and the 'tablet' was actually a PC, I have been totally blown away. Admittedly it didn't all really become evident until all the updates were in place but the processing power, screen resolution, full Windows 10 Pro and the outstanding Pen combine to make a true superhero of a 'tablet'. I am very pleased I decided on this rather than the other contending products working with full office suite and adobe photographic tools is a real pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Autolocus

customer_reviews.title: I love my Surface - one downside though
customer_reviews.text: I love my Surface - one downside though.... you cannot download an Amazon Prime App and therefore can only stream videos as opposed to downloading them. Honestly Amazon, get your act together and create a Microsoft Amazon App!!!! You have one for Android, Apple... why sell products which are incompatible with your own things! Very disappointed and will probably have to switch to Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: Goupy

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this until they can ensure the bugs are fixed
customer_reviews.text: I have now tried two machines - the first was full of bugs and camera did not work - the second one bugs in windows 10 software meant that programmes kept disappearing after 1-2 seconds. This is very disappointing - as the machine loos and feels beautiful - but they need much more robust testing before dispatching to customers. I am pretty computer literate but do not expect to have to spend half a day to find out why the camera cannot be found by the software straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: billm

customer_reviews.title: I am a tech guy and disappointed with the product
customer_reviews.text: I am a tech guy and disappointed with the product, not the purchase but the actual Surface , i sold my mac book air and changed to this due to some work incompatibility issues. Things like hello windows dont always work typical windows approach offer 100 that work in 90% don't trick your selfs with features , usability is the key and this thing has: battery not worth for money paid (3-4 hours) windows hellos feature that operates on its mood, and my son when using it as tablet says it's not ipad , so if want both worlds NOT good things pay and get it , other than that get a good laptop or good tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Papadakakis Emmanouil

customer_reviews.title: Fanless and still performing well
customer_reviews.text: Even the Core m3 version is powerful enough for office work. I use heavy Excel sheets, Access, RDP sessions, lots of browser tabs, I watch full HD movies - no problem. I don't regret going with this fanless version instead of the Core i5. RAM seems to be enough though my previous computers had 8GB onboard. The screen is a beauty, the pen works fine. Battery is mediocre but who cares. This thing is amazing. Should I need to work away from the plug for extended periods, I will get an external battery. There are plentiful of those here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Balint

customer_reviews.title: RAM IS NOT UPGRADABLE
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately nowhere on this site is it stated the RAM is NOT upgradeable. Watching videos is a constant buffering experience, not great ... I'm stuck with a paltry 4GB which for £650 stings a bit. AS such only 3 stars. That said it has a good battery and responsive screen and is useful as a day to day note book (literally taking down short notes).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a great product for lightweight things
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product for lightweight things. As an IT professional, I've managed to do reporting through Excel, PowerBI, MS SQL. It also provides great browsing experience.
customer_reviews.author: Deniz Tasdogen

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking machine but major flaw
customer_reviews.text: My experience with this machine mirrors other peoples. Nice looking unit, nice and light, with a good key board, a joy to use and carry around with me and take on trips. However every now and again especially after receiving updates it won't turn on. I have to hard start it by pushing the start and sound button together. Sometimes this works immediately other times I have to keep doing it, which is very worrying. Going on reviews on Amazon and other sites this is a common problem. I can't see why Microsoft continue to sell this machine while it has such a basic fault.They need to correct it and then replace all the units they have sold.
customer_reviews.author: Suejim126

customer_reviews.title: Annoying mouse. Basically this is a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely does not perform as stated. Battery life max. 3 hours and that is from day one. Issues with performance of office 365. Apparently office package installed properly (checked by Microsoft). Annoying mouse. Basically this is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Macmillan

customer_reviews.title: satisfied with the
customer_reviews.text: What I expected it would be, satisfied with the product

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Surface Pro 4 12.3-Inch Tablet with Pen (Silver) - (Intel Core i7-6660U 2.2 GHz, 16 GB RAM, 256 GB SSD
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item os 2-4-16 and, apart from freezing problems which have been experienced by many other buyers, I was quite happy with it. Then the 3D camera stopped working which I used for logging on with. There is also a problem with downloading updates, and it is still suffering from freezing problems. I have been on many forums and tried numerous suggestions to rectify these problems and to date none of them have worked. Would I recommend this item to anyone.....not until Microsoft sell trouble free products. Very disapointed with this item and still trying to fix it.
